data.text: @Imanismami @StarAdvertiser @GovHawaii @HawaiiDOH @LtGovJoshGreen @DOTHawaii @HawaiiHTA So basically you have a bunch of anecdotal evidence about how kids die, but ignore the absolute numbers and the fact the risk for kids is extremely low. Lower than most strains of the flu. The opposite is true for the elderly, but not for children.

@rbluff7 @StarAdvertiser @GovHawaii @HawaiiDOH @LtGovJoshGreen @DOTHawaii @HawaiiHTA Again real children are not just "data" and the numbers that suffer from MIS-C and Long COVID are just as important as those "few" you count who die. Avoiding death alone is not the gold standard you think it is.
@Imanismami @StarAdvertiser @GovHawaii @HawaiiDOH @LtGovJoshGreen @DOTHawaii @HawaiiHTA Anecdotal. I already responded to the real data.

@rbluff7 @StarAdvertiser @GovHawaii @HawaiiDOH @LtGovJoshGreen @DOTHawaii @HawaiiHTA The "numbers" are real children. And they aren't even counting the ones that "survive" but were seriously ill and hospitalized. That is a public health failure. 
https://t.co/fgNA5p9hyz

@Imanismami @StarAdvertiser @GovHawaii @HawaiiDOH @LtGovJoshGreen @DOTHawaii @HawaiiHTA Latest data in the UK shows 96% of kids there have antibodies either from infection or vaccination. Keep in mind they never required vaccines for most children.

@rbluff7 @StarAdvertiser @GovHawaii @HawaiiDOH @LtGovJoshGreen @DOTHawaii @HawaiiHTA 58% is actually pretty low when you remember that the initial goal for the public with less contagious stains of COVID was 70% and real herd immunity for similar infectious diseases like the measles is maintained with a 90% vaccination rate.
